div.p: SPRAY, the ſprinkling of the ſea, which is driven from the top oſ a wave in ſtormy weather. It differs from spoon-drift, as being only blown occaſionally from the broken ſurface of a high wave ; whereas the latter continues to fly horizontally along the ſea, without intermiſſion, during the excels of a tempeſt or hurricane.
